segments.text: May , we are fools to hang out at noon . It's dying hot today . My skin is too weak to be exposed under the summer sun .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Do you have any sunscreen lotion ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You know , honey , I used it all on the way over .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think I'm getting a heart stroke .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The heat is driving crazy and I hate my new hat .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Why ? It's brand new , and it's perfect on you .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But I bought it to get rid of the heat . Now it does nothing but burning my head .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Laugh all you want , whatever . We need to get out of the heat .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Walking under the sun is certainly not the way .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Give me a break . It's not funny .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Right . Sorry . Anyway , the radio said that it'll rain later today .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Hope so ! Good thing is that autumn is just around the corner .
segments.speaker: S1
